p: The spike glycoprotein from SARS-CoV is a promising drug target. In this regard, a lectin called Griffithsin derived from red algae is known to be able to bind several viral glycoproteins, including SARS-CoV spike glycoprotein and HIV glycoprotein. Griffithsin was used in a preventive evaluated test to HIV, as gel and enema. However, to reach a preventive treatment to SARS-CoV-2, the delivery systems of spike inhibitors needs to be reevaluated [ 118, 144]. No record was found regarding the effects of Griffithsin on pregnant women.
